Night Shift knew that the only way to escape now would be in robot mode.  T=
he question was, could he transform?  He slowly attempts the transformation=
 from vehicle to robot mode, and with each painful shift of the metal, he m=
anages to get himself in robot mode, but finds himself pinned inside the to=
ppled trees.

"Slag.  No gettn' outa this mess.  I'm pinned in real good Ra=
t Trap..."

Rat Trap swallows hard.

"Well, at least ya tried.  Now what?"
=

The ground vibrates beneath them.  Night Shift feels it.

"First giant bug=
s, and now large foot steps commn' right at us.  Not good."

Rat Trap peeks=
 out from beneath the brush, and spots a familliar Dinosaur lumbering their=
 way.  

"Hey, remember that big dino that ya helped out back there?  I thi=
nk he's back."

The stegosaurous lumbers closser to the fallen trees, and t=
hen senses danger around the pile. Yet instead of fleeing, he grumbles and =
growls at the insecticons, stamping his feet to ward them off, and swiping =
his tail to keep them away from the pile.  As he does that, the female and =
the baby stegosaurous now help to get Rat Trap and Night Shift out by movin=
g the logs with their mouths, also surrounding them protectively as they do=
 so.  It appeared that NONE of them would move without a fight.
